messages.messageBody:

> It's amazing what other people know :-) this is a horse trainer's website,
> and she's the co-author of a book I'm reading right now. This article is
> excerpted in the book, which inspired me to find it online.

I guess I should have included the url, huh? LOL I was late for work!

http://www.lesliedesmond.com/articles/us/horse13-4.asp

Nancy

messages.messageBody:
It's amazing what other people know :-) this is a horse trainer's website,
and she's the co-author of a book I'm reading right now. This article is
excerpted in the book, which inspired me to find it online.

Nancy

messages.subject: Redirect politely
messages.msgSnippet: I m giving just a bit more info on the exhibitionists in my house. I love them to be comfy with their bodies. I get annoyed when the kids start interacting
messages.messageBody:
I'm giving just a bit more info on the exhibitionists in my house. I love them
to be comfy with their bodies. I get annoyed when the kids start interacting
with eachother and the exposed body parts. 2.5 knows only that 5.5 makes her
laugh. She thinks it fun to copy him, so they run around sticking bottoms up
in the air at eachother laughing hystically. I do ask that they take private
matters to a private spot. I have yet to talk about masterbation. I do say
it's ok to explore your body, in your own space, like your room or bathroom. I
tell them to keep their privates private, which they get in public. It's at
home they go cookoo. I do try to make it a non issue, I just don't react well
when I walk into a room and 5.5 is sniffing 2.5, or 5.5 is pulling back his
forskin to show 2.5. Or 5.5 strutts down the hall with said body part out
chasing dd8. Like I said, it's the interaction of the two that gets to me.
Thanks to all you moms for sharing your boy stories. Anyone out ther dealt
with this particular issue?
